This phrase reiterates the idea of rapid accessibility.', 'Immediate - This word implies that something happens quickly and without delay.', 'Instantly obtainable - Similar to #5, this phrase emphasizes immediate availability.', 'Convenient - This adjective describes something as being easy to use or access.', 'Readily accessible - This phrase is similar to #4, emphasizing ease of access.', 'Within reach - This idiom suggests that something can be easily obtained or accessed.', 'Available at short notice - This phrase implies that something can be quickly made available when needed.', 'Up-to-the-minute - This phrase emphasizes the idea of being current and readily available.', 'Promptly available - Similar to #8, this phrase reiterates the idea of rapid accessibility.', 'Quick-fetching - This phrase is an informal way of saying that something can be quickly obtained or accessed.', 'Straightforward to obtain - This phrase emphasizes the ease of getting something.', 'Directly obtainable - This phrase suggests that something can be immediately acquired.', 'Instantaneously accessible - This phrase reiterates the idea of rapid accessibility and immediate availability.', 'Unfed - This word means without food or nourishment.', "Undernourished - This adjective describes a lack of essential nutrients in one's diet.", 'Malnourished - Similar to #2, this word emphasizes the negative impact of inadequate nutrition.', 'Starving - This verb implies that someone is extremely hungry and lacks sufficient sustenance.', 'Famished - This adjective means extremely hungry or famished.', 'Hungry stomach - This phrase describes a physical sensation of hunger.', 'Inadequately fed - This phrase emphasizes the idea of not receiving enough food or nutrients.', 'Underfed - This word implies that someone lacks sufficient sustenance.', 'Deprived of food - This phrase emphasizes the negative impact of lacking access to essential sustenance.', "Nutrient-deficient - This adjective describes a lack of essential nutrients in one's diet.", 'Fasting (when unintended) - This phrase suggests an unintended or involuntary period of not eating.', 'Empty belly - This phrase describes a physical sensation of hunger.', 'Goiter (indirectly related to left hungry) - A goiter is a swelling of the neck caused by iodine deficiency, which can lead to malnutrition and hunger.', "Vitamin deficiency - This phrase emphasizes the negative impact of lacking essential vitamins in one's diet.", "Picky eater - While not directly related to hunger, this phrase can lead to hunger if someone's diet is limited or restrictive.", 'Food insecurity - This phrase describes a lack of access to sufficient food and nutrition.', 'Underfed child - This phrase emphasizes the negative impact of malnutrition on children.', 'Unfulfilled appetite - This phrase describes a physical sensation of remaining hungry.', 'Empty pantry - This phrase describes a situation where there is no food available.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - This phrase emphasizes the physical consequences of hunger and inadequate nutrition.']
